text:
BIG BOI: I'm on the
stump like a black Trump,
but the people love me--
[music - big boi, "kill jill"]

(SINGING) Chicago's
full of shooters,
my garage is full of hoopties

Got that Southern
drawl and all that

My pretty rose look
like ball-bats--

BIG BOI: An album is supposed to
be a time capsule that captures

the essence of your
life since the last time
a listener heard you.

And, you know, it's just like
a personal diary, you know.

So we touch on everything,
from relationships
to police brutality.
[music - big boi, "kill jill"]

(SINGING) --don't I look classy,
[mute] don't act so sassy

I'm the, I'm the man,
boo, that's with--

BIG BOI: We're getting a
chance to see more of what's

being done to unarm
citizens, you know,

as well as those that
are licensed to carry,
like a Philando Castile.

We're seeing the
videos, we're seeing

these people being
murdered in cold blood,
like with Philando Castile.

VALERIE CASTILE: My
son loved this city,
and this city killed my son.
And the murderer gets away.

BIG BOI: The police are
not playing by the rules,
you know what I mean?

So you can film all
the videos and you can
record everything you want to.

But, like, there are no
convictions behind this.

Then everything gets swept
under the rug, you know?

And, I mean, I just
think it's just wrong.

And we've got to continue to
fight and protest and march.

I think the anti-establishment
does have a voice.

And, you know,
the Democrat needs

to listen to that,
you know what I mean,

and kind of bring
those people in.

Because there's a lot
of power in the youth

and in these intelligent
individuals who

have political opinions
on what's going on.

You can't just try to, you
know, backstop and try to go
and do things the old way.

Like, you have to
listen to the people.

It's all about the will
of the people, man.
You know what I mean?
That's how Trump got in there.
He got the will of the people.

He turned the people against
the establishment and won.
